hero.headline: The operating system private equity real estate funds actually need
hero.subheadline: Replace generalized platforms with a capability-driven environment built for fund accounting, cash control, and investor trust.

pillars: Stop funding platform bloat that does not match fund operations
Run finance, operations, and reporting behind clear controls and audit trails
Add or replace capabilities without committing to a single vendor roadmap
whatYouGet: An executive-level view of where platform costs and operational risk are actually concentrated
A capability blueprint that maps fund accounting, cash flows, waterfalls, and reporting to governed modules
Industry presets that shorten implementation without forcing fund-specific workflows into generic templates
Parallel-run plans and reconciliation checkpoints that CFOs and auditors can sign off on
A controlled path to cutover with rollback criteria, approval gates, and documented ownership

deliverables.title: Capability control map
deliverables.description: A fund-specific map of core capabilities, upstream dependencies, and the control points required to govern change.

deliverables.title: Finance-grade baselines
deliverables.description: Defined reconciliation rules, data contracts, and reporting baselines for accounting, cash, and investor outcomes.

deliverables.title: Parallel-run scorecard
deliverables.description: Evidence that new modules produce matching results before any system-of-record decision is made.

deliverables.title: Cutover governance pack
deliverables.description: Approval gates, decision logs, rollback criteria, and continuity steps that protect operations during transition.

deliverables.title: Optionality roadmap
deliverables.description: A sequenced plan for adding, retiring, or swapping capabilities without reopening the entire platform debate.
